member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.City
member.summary: City-level data associated with an IP address.
member.remarks: Do not use any of the city names as a database or dictionary key. Use the instead.

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.City.Confidence
member.summary: A value from 0-100 indicating MaxMind's confidence that the city is correct. This value is only set when using the Insights web service or the Enterprise database.

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Continent
member.summary: Contains data for the continent record associated with an IP address. Do not use any of the continent names as a database or dictionary key. Use the or instead.

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Continent.Code
member.summary: A two character continent code like "NA" (North America) or "OC" (Oceania).

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Country
member.summary: Contains data for the country record associated with an IP address. Do not use any of the country names as a database or dictionary key. Use the or instead.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Country.Confidence
member.summary: A value from 0-100 indicating MaxMind's confidence that the country is correct. This value is only set when using the Insights web service or the Enterprise database.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Country.IsoCode
member.summary:
The
two-character ISO 3166-1 alpha code
for the country.

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location
member.summary: Contains data for the location record associated with an IP address.

member.name: M:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.AccuracyRadius
member.summary: The radius in kilometers around the specified location where the IP address is likely to be. This value is only set when using the Insights web service or the Enterprise database.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.AverageIncome
member.summary: The average income in US dollars associated with the IP address.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.HasCoordinates
member.summary: Determines whether both the Latitude and Longitude have values.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.Latitude
member.summary: The approximate latitude of the location associated with the IP address. This value is not precise and should not be used to identify a particular address or household.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.Longitude
member.summary: The approximate longitude of the location associated with the IP address. This value is not precise and should not be used to identify a particular address or household.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.MetroCode
member.summary: The metro code of the location if the location is in the US. MaxMind returns the same metro codes as the Google AdWords API.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.PopulationDensity
member.summary: The estimated number of people per square kilometer.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.TimeZone
member.summary:
The time zone associated with location, as specified by the
IANA Time Zone Database
, e.g., "America/New_York".

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.RepresentedCountry
member.summary: Contains data for the represented country associated with an IP address. This class contains the country-level data associated with an IP address for the IP's represented country. member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.AutonomousSystemNumber
member.summary:
The

associated with the IP address. This value is only set when using the City or Insights web service or the Enterprise database.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.AutonomousSystemOrganization
member.summary:
The organization associated with the registered
autonomous system number
for the IP address. This value is only set when using the City or Insights web service or the Enterprise database.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.ConnectionType
member.summary: The connection type of the IP address. This value is only set when using the Enterprise database.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.Domain
member.summary: The second level domain associated with the IP address. This will be something like "example.com" or "example.co.uk", not "foo.example.com". This value is only set when using the City or Insights web service or the Enterprise database.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.IPAddress
member.summary: The IP address that the data in the model is for. If you performed a "me" lookup against the web service, this will be the externally routable IP address for the system the code is running on. If the system is behind a NAT, this may differ from the IP address locally assigned to it.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.IsAnonymousProxy
member.summary:
This is true if the IP is an anonymous proxy. See
MaxMind's GeoIP FAQ

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.IsLegitimateProxy
member.summary: True if MaxMind believes this IP address to be a legitimate proxy, such as an internal VPN used by a corporation.This is only available in the GeoIP2 Enterprise database.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.IsSatelliteProvider
member.summary: This is true if the IP belong to a satellite Internet provider.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.Isp
member.summary: The name of the ISP associated with the IP address. This value is only set when using the City or Insights web service or the Enterprise database.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.Organization
member.summary: The name of the organization associated with the IP address. This value is only set when using the City or Insights web service or the Enterprise database.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.UserType
member.summary:
The user type associated with the IP address. This can be one of the following values:
business
cafe
cellular
college
content_delivery_network
dialup
government
hosting
library
military
residential
router
school
search_engine_spider
traveler
This value is only set when using the City or Insights web service or the Enterprise database.

member.summary: Gets the city for the requested IP address.

member.summary: Gets the postal object for the requested IP address.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.AbstractCityResponse.Subdivisions
member.summary: An of objects representing the country subdivisions for the requested IP address. The number and type of subdivisions varies by country, but a subdivision is typically a state, province, county, etc. Subdivisions are ordered from most general (largest) to most specific (smallest). If the response did not contain any subdivisions, this method returns an empty array.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.AbstractCityResponse.MostSpecificSubdivision
member.summary: An object representing the most specific subdivision returned. If the response did not contain any subdivisions, this method returns an empty object.

member.summary: Represented country record for the requested IP address. The represented country is used for things like military bases or embassies. It is only present when the represented country differs from the country.

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.InsightsResponse
member.summary:
This class provides a model for the data returned by the GeoIP2 Precision: Insights end point. The only difference between the City and Insights response classes is which fields in each record may be populated.
GeoIP2 Web Services

member.name: M:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.InsightsResponse.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor
Constructor

summary.para: This class provides a client API for all the GeoIP2 Precision web service end points. The end points are Country, City, and Insights. Each end point returns a different set of data about an IP address, with Country returning the least data and Insights the most.
Each web service end point is represented by a different model class which contains data about the IP address.
If the web service does not return a particular piece of data for an IP address, the associated property is not populated.
The web service may not return any information for an entire record, in which case all of the properties for that model class will be empty.

The basic API for this class is the same for all of the web service end points. First you create a web service object with your MaxMind userID and licenseKey, then you call the method corresponding to a specific end point, passing it the IP address you want to look up.
If the request fails, the client class throws an exception.

For details on the possible errors returned by the web service itself, see
the GeoIP2 web service documentation
.
